intro: Cyperus pulvinatus, commonly known as the spikerush, is a flowering plant belonging to the sedge family (Cyperaceae). It is characterized by its grass-like appearance, with narrow, cylindrical leaves and dense clusters of small, spike-like flowers. The plant typically grows in wetland environments, such as marshes, swamps, and along the edges of ponds. Cyperus pulvinatus is often found in tropical and subtropical regions, and it plays a role in stabilizing soil and providing habitat for aquatic organisms. Its ability to thrive in saturated soils makes it an important component of wetland ecosystems.
